qas.question: Insects with fine scale spatial orientation live in colonies and where else?
Some insects have a fine scale spatial orientation and/or what else?
Spacial orientation/homing allows an insect to return to one specific hole among how many?
An insect recalling a specific location for up to a year is called what?
An insect that can recall a specific location for up to a year does what?

context: Only insects which live in <a0_0>nests<a0_0/> or colonies demonstrate any true capacity for fine-scale spatial orientation or <a1_0>homing<a1_0/>. This can allow an insect to return unerringly to a single hole a few millimeters in diameter among <a2_0>thousands<a2_0/> of apparently identical holes clustered together, after a trip of up to several kilometers' distance. In a phenomenon known as <a3_0>philopatry<a3_0/>, insects that <a4_0>hibernate<a4_0/> have shown the ability to recall a specific location up to a year after last viewing the area of interest. A few insects seasonally migrate large distances between different geographic regions (e.g., the overwintering areas of the Monarch butterfly).:14
